Debutan MotoGP Diperbolehkan Turun di Uji Coba 'Shakedown'
07 Nov 2019, 09:30 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Grand Prix Commission (GPC) resmi mengumumkan beberapa regulasi baru untuk musim balap 2020, baik untuk Moto2 maupun MotoGP, pada Rabu (6/11/2019). Regulas yang paling disorot adalah fasilitas wildcard di Moto2 dan perubahan aturan dalam uji coba MotoGP.
Anggota GPC terdiri dari CEO Dorna Sports, Carmelo Ezpeleta; perwakilan FIM (Paul Duparc); Presiden IRTA, Herve Poncharal, dan perwakilan MSMA, Takanao Tsubouchi. Mereka melakukan pertemuan di Sepang, Malaysia, Sabtu (2/11/2019), yang juga dihadiri Presiden FIM, Jorge Viegas; Sporting Director Dorna Sports, Carlos Ezpeleta; Sekretaris IRTA, Mike Trimby, dan Direktur Teknologi MotoGP, Corrado Cecchinelli.
Tak hanya wildcard Moto2 dan aturan uji coba MotoGP, GPC juga menindaklanjuti insiden-insiden kecelakaan di Sirkuit Phillip Island, Australia, yang terjadi akibat angin kencang. Berikut regulasi-regulasi baru Moto2 dan MotoGP yang dirilis pada Rabu (6/11/2019) lewat MotoGP.com.
text:
MotoGP debut allowed to drop in 'Shakedown' trial
Nov 7 2019, 09:30 by Bola.net
Bola.net - The Grand Prix Commission (GPC) officially announced several new regulations for the 2020 racing season, both for Moto2 and MotoGP, on Wednesday (6/11/2019). The most highlighted regulations are the wildcard facility in Moto2 and the change of rules in the MotoGP trial.
GPC members include Dorna Sports CEO Carmelo Ezpeleta; FIM representative (Paul Duparc); IRTA President, Herve Poncharal, and MSMA representative Takanao Tsubouchi. They held a meeting in Sepang, Malaysia, Saturday (2/11/2019), which was also attended by FIM President, Jorge Viegas; Dorna Sports Sporting Director Carlos Ezpeleta; IRTA Secretary, Mike Trimby, and MotoGP Technology Director, Corrado Cecchinelli.
Not only the Moto2 wildcard and MotoGP trial rules, GPC also follows up on accident incidents at the Phillip Island Circuit, Australia, which occurred due to strong winds. The following new regulations Moto2 and MotoGP were released on Wednesday (11/06/2019) via MotoGP.com.
